Authors:
Andy Robert Nilsen, Xin Yue Wang, Karl Soop, Jerry A
Cooper, Tina Claire Summerfield, Chris Michael Brown, David Allan
Orlovich
Title:
Four new species of Cortinarius purple pouch fungi from New
Zealand
Keywords:
Nothofagus; secotioid; sequestrate; Thaxterogaster; 4 new
taxa
Abstract:
Cortinarius is a species rich, ectomycorrhizal genus that
contains taxa that exhibit either agaricoid or sequestrate morphologies.
In New Zealand, one of the most recognizable Cortinarius species is the
purple pouch fungus, C. porphyroideus. Here we describe four new species
of Cortinarius with similarity to C. porphyroideus: Cortinarius
diaphorus, C. minorisporus, C. ostradsignatos, C. purpureocapitatus.
These new species are associated with Nothofagus spp. and have very
similar morphology to C. porphyroideus, but are phylogenetically
distinct based on the internal transcribed spacer region and the large
ribosomal subunit. In addition, based on molecular evidence,
Thaxterogaster viola is synonymized with C. porphyroideus and C.
violaceovolvatus is recognised as C. porphyroideus var.
violaceovolvatus.
